Lewis Mumford, although heavily influenced by Sombart, objected to Sombart's emphasis on the shift from the organic to the inorganic; the emerging neotechnic age, claimed Mumford, was witnessing a "returning to the organic" (Technics and Civilization [New York, 1963], pp. 371-72)
